content.description: THE ROLE OF SHARIAH LAW IN NIGERIAN STATESSource: United States Department of State, 2006. Type of Law Number of States (total of 36) Shariah law applies all cases, including criminal law 9 Shariah law applies in personal status issues only 3 Shariah law plays no role in the judicial system 24
content.question: Which of the following best explains the data in the table?

choices.label: Nigeria’s system of proportional representation requires that all states allow Muslims access to Shariah law.
Because of Nigeria’s winner-take-all system, states with a Christian majority must allow courts to practice Shariah law.
Nigeria has a federal system, which allows for different systems of laws in different states.
Nigeria has a unitary system, which allows for regional governments to have discretion over when to use Shariah law.

content.answer: Nigeria has a federal system, which allows for different systems of laws in different states.
